The Honorable Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg inculcated justice for women in our historically patriarchal society and judiciously paved the way for legalizing equal pay for equal work. We mourn her loss and pay our respects knowing her legacy will withstand the test of time. https://t.co/Y2fxoOlMJW
Within the next 15 minutes I will address Breonna Taylor’s death and yesterday’s grand jury decision on the House Floor. Tune in via @cspan.   #BreonnaTaylorMatters #BlackLivesMatter

If Breonna Taylor were a 26-year-old innocent unarmed White woman who was killed in the middle of the night when Black police officers intruded into her home would her death be a tragedy or a crime?   #BreonnaTaylorMatters

I demand justice for Breonna Taylor; the same justice she would receive if she were a 26-year-old innocent white woman sleeping in her home when wrongfully killed by the police. Injustice cannot be justified. #JusticeForBreonnaTaylor

If we deny climate change we don’t have to address it. If we deny systemic racism we don’t have to address it. Denying the existence of qualified Black talent is Wells Fargo’s way of continuing the status quo and not addressing the need for diversity. We must address it!

Tonight we mourn the loss of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg a trailblazing attorney and activist who was a stalwart in the fight for women’s rights. In what many perceived to be a man’s world she had the courage to stand strong as a woman’s woman. Her legacy will transcend time.
Shanah Tovah to the Jewish community! This weekend as you celebrate #RoshHashanah among family and friends I wish you a safe and healthy New Year!

The accusation that women detained in ICE custody may have undergone unauthorized hysterectomies stripping them of their right to reproduce should prompt pro-life & pro-choice advocates alike to demand an immediate & thorough investigation.

Tune in to the House Floor this morning via  @cspan at the top of the 9 AM ET/8 AM CT hour. I'll be speaking on my belief that the moral movement for justice everywhere must not condone injustice anywhere.

I condemn the shooting of the two LA sheriff’s deputies and call for the shooter to be found and brought to justice. The moral movement for justice everywhere must not condone injustice anywhere. My prayers are with the officers and their families.

That President #TrumpKnew the dangers of this deadly virus and intentionally downplayed it further validates that he is unfit to be president. Of the nearly 190K lives lost and 6.3M+ positives how many would be spared had our president not treated this crisis like a “hoax”?

A happy first day of school should be safe. Many schools will open their doors today w/o much needed equipment to mitigate COVID-19 spread. The Senate must pass the Heroes Act which includes $58B for K-12 schools. The lives of students faculty & staff could depend on it.

Labor Day is not a random day off; it’s the recognition of unions' labor and strategic persistent organizing. As we enjoy this day let's thank our local unions for their efforts to ensure employers offer a safe fair work environment for all even during COVID-19. #LaborDay2020

The fight for voting rights did not end in 1965 with the stroke of a pen. We must continue advocating for a more fair and equitable voting system. In the spirit of #GoodTrouble I implore the Senate to #RestoreTheVote and pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.

55 years ago today the #VotingRightsAct was signed into law by President Johnson in ink but written in the blood of freedom fighters such as John Lewis and C.T. Vivian which was shed on the Edmund Pettus Bridge months prior. Their fight is now our fight.

This pandemic has threatened our lives and our livelihoods. Too many Americans are on the brink of financial ruin without the HEROES Act and @RepMaxineWaters' Emergency Rental Assistance Act. As Senate Republicans stall Americans continue to suffer needlessly. Rent is due.

5000+ evictions have been filed in Harris County since the pandemic began. 40% of Houstonians can't afford rent. Senate Republicans must #StopEvictions and implement #RentReliefNow. Stop this tsunami of evictions and looming housing crisis from destroying countless lives.

The federal eviction moratorium expired 12 days ago and unemployment benefits lapsed 6 days ago. Yet Senate Republicans have not passed much needed legislation that could save millions of Americans from homelessness and poverty. #StopEvictions #RentReliefNow
https://t.co/n2KurH1hno
